High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-16T18:32:46

2 posts

Due to large allocation checks in Angle for GLSL shaders being too lenient an out-of-bounds access could occur when allocating more than 8192 ints in private shader memory on mac OS. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Firefox ESR < 115.13.

CVE-2024-6613(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-16T18:32:46

2 posts

H3liumb0y at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.844Z ##

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615

  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

Tags

#Firefox #CVE2024-6605 #Tapjacking #SecurityUpdate #Mozilla #Vulnerability #MemoryCorruption #OutOfBoundsRead

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.000Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

Tags

#Firefox #CVE2024-6605 #Tapjacking #SecurityUpdate #Mozilla #Vulnerability #MemoryCorruption #OutOfBoundsRead

##

CVE-2024-6615
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-16T18:15:09.893000

2 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 127 and Thunderbird 127. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Thunderbird < 128.

H3liumb0y at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.844Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

It was possible to prevent a user from exiting pointerlock when pressing escape and to overlay customValidity notifications from a `&lt;select&gt;` element over certain permission prompts. This could be used to confuse a user into giving a site unintended permissions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128 and Thunderbird < 128.

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.000Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

Tags

#Firefox #CVE2024-6605 #Tapjacking #SecurityUpdate #Mozilla #Vulnerability #MemoryCorruption #OutOfBoundsRead

##

CVE-2024-6604
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-16T18:15:09.077000

2 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 127, Firefox ESR 115.12, and Thunderbird 115.12. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128, Firefox ESR < 115.13, Thunderbird < 115.13, and Thunderbird < 128.

H3liumb0y at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.844Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.000Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

##

CVE-2024-6603
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-16T18:15:08.990000

2 posts

In an out-of-memory scenario an allocation could fail but free would have been called on the pointer afterwards leading to memory corruption. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128, Firefox ESR < 115.13, Thunderbird < 115.13, and Thunderbird < 128.

H3liumb0y at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.844Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

##

CVE-2024-38112
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.61%

updated 2024-07-13T00:31:12

24 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability

threatcodex at 2024-07-18T13:15:14.609Z ##

CVE-2024-38112: Void Banshee Targets Windows Users Through Zombie Internet Explorer in Zero-Day Attacks
#CVE_2024_38112 #VoidBanshee
https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/g/CVE-2024-38112-void-banshee.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-15T15:05:15.162Z ##

Trend Micro: CVE-2024-38112: Void Banshee Targets Windows Users Through Zombie Internet Explorer in Zero-Day Attacks
Trend Micro reports that financially motivated APT "Void Banshee" exploited CVE-2024-38112 as a zero-day to drop the Atlantida infostealer. See parent toots above for more information on the vulnerability. They provide a technical analysis on the attack chain and on Atlantida malware. IOC proivded.

Interestingly Trend Micro did not receive any credit for reporting Microsoft zero-day CVE-2024-38112 to MSRC. Check Point Research was credited and wrote an article about its exploitation.

In related The Register reporting, Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative alleges that CVE-2024-38112 actually allows for remote code execution and deserves a reevaluation.

#CVE_2024_38112 #threatintel #eitw #activeexploitation #zeroday #IOC #Atlantida #VoidBanshee #cybercrime

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-13T02:44:09.206Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) updated CVE-2024-38112 (7.5 high, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA KEV Catalog) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability:
Updated CWE value. This is an informational change only.

Weakness:
CWE-451: User Interface (UI) Misrepresentation of Critical Information

#Microsoft #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38112 #eitw #activeexploitation

In related The Register reporting, Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative alleges that CVE-2024-38112 actually allows for remote code execution and deserves a reevaluation.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-15T22:54:06.954Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Uncoordinated Vulnerability Disclosure: The Continuing Issues with CVD
See parent toot about Trend Micro's reporting of CVE-2024-38112 as a zero-day to Microsoft. @TheDustinChilds rips Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) a new one on their lack of communication and coordination for adhering to a vulnerability disclosure process. Valid critiques of Microsoft.

#Microsoft #vulnerability #vulnerabilitydisclosure #CVE #MSRC

##

CVE-2024-39698
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-07-12T19:20:31

2 posts

### Observations The file `packages/electron-updater/src/windowsExecutableCodeSignatureVerifier.ts` implements the signature validation routine for Electron applications on Windows. It executes the following command in a new shell (`process.env.ComSpec` on Windows, usually `C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe`): https://github.com/electron-userland/electron-builder/blob/140e2f0eb0df79c2a46e35024e96d05633

1 repos

#search_error

swapgs at 2024-07-17T10:50:55.532Z ##

Electron Userland just released a patch for a code signature bypass in electron-updater for Windows I found a few weeks back (CVE-2024-39698): https://github.com/electron-userland/electron-builder/security/advisories/GHSA-9jxc-qjr9-vjxq. I'll likely publish a write-up in the coming weeks, it's a fun one ;-)

##

##

CVE-2024-22280
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-07-12T18:32:53

2 posts

VMware Aria Automation does not apply correct input validation which allows for SQL-injection in the product. An authenticated malicious user could enter specially crafted SQL queries and perform unauthorised read/write operations in the database.

jbhall56 at 2024-07-11T11:12:13.371Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-22280, allows for unauthorized read and write operations in the database through specially crafted SQL queries, VMWare said in an advisory with a “high-severity” rating. https://www.securityweek.com/vmware-patches-critical-sql-injection-flaw-in-aria-automation/

CVE-2024-38475
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-12T15:31:25

2 posts

Improper escaping of output in mod_rewrite in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.59 and earlier allows an attacker to map URLs to filesystem locations that are permitted to be served by the server but are not intentionally/directly reachable by any URL, resulting in code execution or source code disclosure. Substitutions in server context that use a backreferences or variables as the first segment of the su

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-24T14:12:43.815Z ##

Apache HTTP Server security advisory: Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.62

  • CVE-2024-40725 (CVSS score pending) Apache HTTP Server: source code disclosure with handlers configured via AddType
  • CVE-2024-40898 (score pending) Apache HTTP Server: SSRF with mod_rewrite in server/vhost context on Windows

No mention of exploitation according to Censys. I don't get how CERT-EU is considering these critical.

  • A vulnerability similar to CVE-2024-40898 which involves "SSRF in Apache HTTP Server...potentially leak NTML hashes" would be CVE-2024-38472 which CISA-ADP scored as a CVSSv3.1 7.5 high severity.
  • A vulnerability semi-similar to CVE-2024-40725 which involves source code disclosure is CVE-2024-38475 which CISA-ADP scored as a CVSSv3.1 9.1 critical.

Why you should care about these Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities: CVE-2021-40438 (9.0 critical) Apache HTTP Server-Side Request Forgery vulnerability is in the CISA KEV Catalog. There are other Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities in the KEV as well, but they're not the same weakness enumeration.

#CVE_2024_40725 #CVE_2024_40898 #Apache #httpserver #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-24T14:12:43.000Z ##

Apache HTTP Server security advisory: Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.62

  • CVE-2024-40898 (score pending) Apache HTTP Server: SSRF with mod_rewrite in server/vhost context on Windows

##

CVE-2024-38472
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-12T15:31:25

2 posts

SSRF in Apache HTTP Server on Windows allows to potentially leak NTML hashes to a malicious server via SSRF and malicious requests or content Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.4.60 which fixes this issue.  Note: Existing configurations that access UNC paths will have to configure new directive "UNCList" to allow access during request processing.

4 posts

Issue summary: Calling the OpenSSL API function SSL_select_next_proto with an empty supported client protocols buffer may cause a crash or memory contents to be sent to the peer. Impact summary: A buffer overread can have a range of potential consequences such as unexpected application beahviour or a crash. In particular this issue could result in up to 255 bytes of arbitrary private data from me

#PatchNOW

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-11T20:57:22.634Z ##

AssetNote: Chaining Three Bugs to Access All Your ServiceNow Data
AssetNote found three vulnerabilities in ServiceNow that allows full database access and full access to any MID servers configured:

  • CVE-2024-4879 (CVSSv4: 9.3 critical, disclosed 10 July 2024) input validation vulnerability to remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-5178 (6.9 medium, disclosed 10 July 2024) sensitive file read vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-5217 (9.2 critical, disclosed 10 July 2024) input validation vulnerability to remote code execution.

Looks like they posted Proofs of Concept without calling them such. AssetNote also notes the following:

While ServiceNow implemented several mitigations to address the risk of double evaluation in the templating system, we found a way to achieve code execution. Even with more mitigations in place, it only takes a single unescaped injection point to risk code execution.

#ServiceNow #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4879 #CVE_2024_5178 #CVE_2024_5217 #proofofconcept #POC

##

CVE-2024-6235(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-11T15:30:48

4 posts

Sensitive information disclosure in NetScaler Console

screaminggoat at 2024-07-15T16:09:51.717Z ##

CERT-EU: 2024-069: Vulnerabilities in Citrix Netscaler
In case you overlooked the Citrix security advisory that I tooted, Netscaler has a 9.4 (critical severity) sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-6235.

Why you should care about CVE-2024-6235: A similar Citrix Netscaler information disclosure vulnerability CVE-2023-4966 #CitrixBleed was massively exploited even by ransomware groups.

#CVE_2024_6235 #Citrix #Netscaler #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2023_4966

https://github.com/Blootus/CVE-2024-20399-Cisco-RCE

jbhall56 at 2024-07-11T11:59:18.748Z ##

The advisory was released in response to recent attacks that exploited multiple OS command injection security flaws (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, and CVE-2024-21887) to compromise Cisco, Palo Alto, and Ivanti network edge devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-urges-devs-to-weed-out-os-command-injection-vulnerabilities/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T11:59:18.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-23692
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.43%

updated 2024-07-10T15:30:28

2 posts

Rejetto HTTP File Server, up to and including version 2.3m, is vulnerable to a template injection vulnerability. This vulnerability allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system by sending a specially crafted HTTP request. As of the CVE assignment date, Rejetto HFS 2.3m is no longer supported.

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-07-22T15:07:46.797Z ##

CERT-UA: UAC-0063 атакує науково-дослідні установи України: HATVIBE + CHERRYSPY + CVE-2024-23692 (CERT-UA#10356) (Ukrainian)
The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) reports that UAC-0063 (associated with Russian military intelligence (GRU) or APT28 with medium confidence) targeted Ukrainian scientific research institutions using HATVIBE + CHERRYSPY malware. They surmise that CVE-2024-23692 (9.8 critical, disclosed 31 May 2024, added to CISA KEV Catalog 09 July 2024) Rejetto HTTP File Server template injection vulnerability was exploited in June 2024 to install HATVIBE backdoors. IOC and infographic images provided.

#threatintel #APT28 #UAC0063 #Russia #Ukraine #CERTUA #cyberespionage #HatVibe #CherrySpy #CVE_2024_23692 #IOC #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE #IOC

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.73%

updated 2024-07-09T21:42:30

11 posts

### Summary Multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. ### Details The GeoTools library API that GeoServer calls evaluates property/attribute names for feature types in a way that unsafely passes them to the common

CISA warns critical Geoserver GeoTools RCE flaw is exploited in attacks

​CISA is warning that a critical GeoServer GeoTools remote code execution flaw tracked as CVE-2024-36401 is being actively exploited in attacks.

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/4wg0am

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-07-16T17:56:10.000Z ##

CISA says threat actors are exploiting a recently patched vulnerability in GeoServer installations.

https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/07/15/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

The attacks are exploiting one of two remote code execution bugs the GeoServer team patched at the start of the month.

Attacks began a week after proof-of-concept code was publicly shared on GitHub.

https://mastodon.social/@shadowserver@infosec.exchange/112797363196711665

https://github.com/vulhub/vulhub/blob/master/geoserver/CVE-2024-36401/README.md

Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024 by GeoServer) GeoServer GeoTools remote code execution vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog based on evidence of exploitation.

hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-07-15T14:58:04.000Z ##

#geology #datascience #osgeo🚨If you use OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools, it contains an improper neutralization of directives in dynamically evaluated code vulnerability due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. This allows unauthenticated attackers to conduct remote code execution via specially crafted input. https://www.cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog?search_api_fulltext=CVE-2024-36401

##

CVE-2024-39929
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T18:31:46

8 posts

Exim through 4.97.1 misparses a multiline RFC 2231 header filename, and thus remote attackers can bypass a $mime_filename extension-blocking protection mechanism, and potentially deliver executable attachments to the mailboxes of end users.

1 repos

#search_error

tienelle@mendeddrum.org at 2024-07-17T08:51:17.000Z ##

So, Exim has a vulnerability (CVE-2024-39929) which lets a slightly malformed e-mail bypass the "We don't accept .exe or .zip files here" filter. That's definitely a security problem! But.

Why is it assigned a score of 9.1, "Critical"? I'd expect something with that kind of score to involve something like RCE or misdirecting mail, not bypassing a fairly simple-minded filter that will only ever be one layer of your security.

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-07-16T09:40:02.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-38021
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-07-09T18:30:51

4 posts

Microsoft Office Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

jtig at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.536Z ##

Very hot take: Outlook (classic) should be regarded as a high-risk application at this point, after the numerous critical vulnerabilities that keep being patched.

These CVE's are responsible for zero-click RCE or token theft in Outlook:

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384
  • may 2023: CVE-2023-29324
  • march 2023: CVE-2023-23397

Outlook Web works just fine for me 🤷

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-10T21:49:46.861Z ##

Morphisec: CVE-2024-38021: Moniker RCE Vulnerability Uncovered in Microsoft Outlook
I know people were chatting about this yesterday so I'll cover it: CVE-2024-38021 (8.8 high, disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft, updated from Microsoft "Office" to Microsoft "Outlook" Remote Code Execution Vulnerability)

Corrected CVE title. This is an informational change only.

Morphisec warns that this "zero-click" RCE vuln requires no authentication. If exploited, CVE-2024-38021 can lead to potential data breaches, unauthorized access, and other malicious activities. While not exploited, not publicly disclosed, and exploitation more likely, it's only marked as Important by Microsoft, and Morphisec requested that they reassess the severity as "Critical."

#CVE_2024_38021 #vulnerability #microsoft #MSRC #CVE #Moniker

##

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384

##

CVE-2024-6605(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-09T15:31:03

2 posts

Firefox Android allowed immediate interaction with permission prompts. This could be used for tapjacking. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 128.

H3liumb0y at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.844Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

Tags

#Firefox #CVE2024-6605 #Tapjacking #SecurityUpdate #Mozilla #Vulnerability #MemoryCorruption #OutOfBoundsRead

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T08:37:16.000Z ##

High-Impact Security Vulnerabilities in Firefox 128

Date: July 9, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-6605 CVE-2024-6606 CVE-2024-6607 CVE-2024-6608 CVE-2024-6609 CVE-2024-6610 CVE-2024-6600 CVE-2024-6601 CVE-2024-6602 CVE-2024-6603 CVE-2024-6611 CVE-2024-6612 CVE-2024-6613 CVE-2024-6614 CVE-2024-6604 CVE-2024-6615
Vulnerability Type: Tapjacking
CWE: [[CWE-451]], [[CWE-922]]
Sources: Mozilla Security Advisory

Synopsis

Multiple security vulnerabilities were addressed in the latest Firefox 128 release, impacting both the desktop and Android versions. These vulnerabilities, if exploited, could lead to severe security breaches including tapjacking, out-of-bounds read, and memory corruption.

A list of all the CVEs mentioned in the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory 2024-29:

  1. CVE-2024-6605: Firefox Android missed activation delay to prevent tapjacking (High)
  2. CVE-2024-6606: Out-of-bounds read in clipboard component (High)
  3. CVE-2024-6607: Leaving pointerlock by pressing the escape key could be prevented (Moderate)
  4. CVE-2024-6608: Cursor could be moved out of the viewport using pointerlock (Moderate)
  5. CVE-2024-6609: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  6. CVE-2024-6610: Form validation popups could block exiting full-screen mode (Moderate)
  7. CVE-2024-6600: Memory corruption in WebGL API (Moderate)
  8. CVE-2024-6601: Race condition in permission assignment (Moderate)
  9. CVE-2024-6602: Memory corruption in NSS (Moderate)
  10. CVE-2024-6603: Memory corruption in thread creation (Moderate)
  11. CVE-2024-6611: Incorrect handling of SameSite cookies (Low)
  12. CVE-2024-6612: CSP violation leakage when using devtools (Low)
  13. CVE-2024-6613: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  14. CVE-2024-6614: Incorrect listing of stack frames (Low)
  15. CVE-2024-6604: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 (High)
  16. CVE-2024-6615: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 128 (High)

Issue Summary

Mozilla announced fixes for several high-impact vulnerabilities in Firefox 128. Notably, CVE-2024-6606 which involves out-of-bounds read issues in the clipboard component, and CVE-2024-6609 related to memory corruption in the NSS library.

Technical Key Findings

CVE-2024-6605 allows attackers to overlay malicious prompts over legitimate permission dialogs, potentially tricking users into granting unwanted permissions. This vulnerability exploits the lack of a delay in activating permission prompts on Firefox Android, enabling immediate interactions which can be hijacked by malicious actors.

Vulnerable Products

  • Firefox versions prior to 128
  • Firefox ESR versions prior to 115.13
  • Firefox Android versions prior to 128

Impact Assessment

If these vulnerabilities are exploited, attackers can perform actions such as reading out-of-bounds data, preventing users from exiting fullscreen mode, or executing arbitrary code. These can lead to unauthorized access to sensitive data, manipulation of browser behavior, and potential system compromises.

Patches or Workaround

Mozilla has released patches in Firefox 128, Firefox ESR 115.13, and Thunderbird 115.13 to address these vulnerabilities. Users are advised to update to the latest versions to mitigate the risks associated with these security flaws.

Tags

#Firefox #CVE2024-6605 #Tapjacking #SecurityUpdate #Mozilla #Vulnerability #MemoryCorruption #OutOfBoundsRead

##

CVE-2024-37903
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-08T15:49:22.437000

8 posts

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. Starting in version 2.6.0 and prior to versions 4.1.18 and 4.2.10, by crafting specific activities, an attacker can extend the audience of a post they do not own to other Mastodon users on a target server, thus gaining access to the contents of a post not intended for them. Versions 4.1.18 and 4.2.10 contain a patch for this issue.

vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-20T14:39:36.000Z ##

2 weeks later, and 77.3% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 93.5% of Mastodon users.

It's been slow going this week. Still a few larger instances that need to patch. Maybe they've been busy rebooting Windows boxes to remove Crowdstrike. Take a break and patch your Mastodon instance.

#MastoAdmin #CVE202437903

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-11T14:23:33.000Z ##

1 week later, and 72.8% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 92.9% of Mastodon users.

Since I'll be traveling for the next few days, and changes will likely be less than 1% from day to day, I will likely not update again until next week.

#MastoAdmin #CVE202437903

2 weeks later, and 77.3% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 93.5% of Mastodon users.

It's been slow going this week. Still a few larger instances that need to patch. Maybe they've been busy rebooting Windows boxes to remove Crowdstrike. Take a break and patch your Mastodon instance.

#MastoAdmin #CVE202437903

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-07-11T14:23:33.000Z ##

1 week later, and 72.8% of Mastodon instances have patched for CVE-2024-37903 providing coverage for 92.9% of Mastodon users.

Since I'll be traveling for the next few days, and changes will likely be less than 1% from day to day, I will likely not update again until next week.

EPSS: 7.61%

updated 2024-07-01T15:31:59

1 posts

A certain Debian patch for OpenSSH before 4.3p2-9etch3 on etch; before 4.6p1-1 on sid and lenny; and on other distributions such as SUSE uses functions that are not async-signal-safe in the signal handler for login timeouts, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (connection slot exhaustion) via multiple login attempts. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CV

updated 2024-06-27T12:30:45

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: netfilter: nf_tables: disallow anonymous set with timeout flag Anonymous sets are never used with timeout from userspace, reject this. Exception to this rule is NFT_SET_EVAL to ensure legacy meters still work.

CVE-2024-30103
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-11T18:30:56

2 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

jtig at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.536Z ##

Very hot take: Outlook (classic) should be regarded as a high-risk application at this point, after the numerous critical vulnerabilities that keep being patched.

These CVE's are responsible for zero-click RCE or token theft in Outlook:

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384
  • may 2023: CVE-2023-29324
  • march 2023: CVE-2023-23397

Outlook Web works just fine for me 🤷

##
jtig@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.000Z ##

  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)

screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T14:02:43.074Z ##

Fortinet: Exploiting CVE-2024-21412: A Stealer Campaign Unleashed
FortiGuard Labs has observed a Meduza and ACR stealer campaign spreading multiple files that exploit CVE-2024-21412 (8.1 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft as an exploited zero-day, added to KEV Catalog same day; Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability) to download malicious executable files. Fortinet describes the infection chain and provides a technical analysis. IOC provided.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T15:25:30.626Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds three to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28995 (7.5 high, disclosed) 05 June 2024) SolarWinds Serv-U Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-22948 (6.5 medium, disclosed 27 March 2022) VMware vCenter Server Incorrect Default File Permissions Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr

@securityaffairs to close this loop - got such exploitation evidence, so CVE-2024-28995 is on the #KEV now (added a few days ago). https://cve.org/kev

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-07-17T18:35:03.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-17T15:25:30.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds three to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-34102 (9.8 critical, disclosed 11 June 2024) Adobe Commerce and Magento Open Source Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-28995 (7.5 high, disclosed) 05 June 2024) SolarWinds Serv-U Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2022-22948 (6.5 medium, disclosed 27 March 2022) VMware vCenter Server Incorrect Default File Permissions Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr

CVE-2024-34359
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-28T17:58:37

2 posts

## Description `llama-cpp-python` depends on class `Llama` in `llama.py` to load `.gguf` llama.cpp or Latency Machine Learning Models. The `__init__` constructor built in the `Llama` takes several parameters to configure the loading and running of the model. Other than `NUMA, LoRa settings`, `loading tokenizers,` and `hardware settings`, `__init__` also loads the `chat template` from targeted `.g

CVE-2024-3400
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.77%

updated 2024-04-29T05:02:31

4 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NG

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-16T14:58:41.894Z ##

Recorded Future: TAG-100 Uses Open-Source Tools in Suspected Global Espionage Campaign, Compromising Two Asia-Pacific Intergovernmental Bodies
Recorded Future identifies a Russian government-aligned influence network, tracked as TAG-100 targeting global government and private sector organizations. TAG-100 has compromised organizations in at least ten countries across Africa, Asia, North America, South America, and Oceania. TAG-100 exploited internet-facing devices and open-source Go backdoors Pantegana and SparkRAT post-exploitation. The campaign compromised two Asia-Pacific intergovernmental organizations and targeted multiple diplomatic and trade entities. TAG-100 conducted reconnaissance and attempted exploitation of CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS Command Injection Vulnerability) against dozens of US-based organizations. IOC provided. Direct link to 14 page PDF

#threatintel #TAG100 #cyberespionage #russia #CVE_2024_3400 #IOC

##
jbhall56 at 2024-07-11T11:59:18.748Z ##

The advisory was released in response to recent attacks that exploited multiple OS command injection security flaws (CVE-2024-20399, CVE-2024-3400, and CVE-2024-21887) to compromise Cisco, Palo Alto, and Ivanti network edge devices. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-urges-devs-to-weed-out-os-command-injection-vulnerabilities/

TAG-100 has compromised organizations in at least ten countries across Africa, Asia, North America, South America, and Oceania. TAG-100 exploited internet-facing devices and open-source Go backdoors Pantegana and SparkRAT post-exploitation. The campaign compromised two Asia-Pacific intergovernmental organizations and targeted multiple diplomatic and trade entities. TAG-100 conducted reconnaissance and attempted exploitation of CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS Command Injection Vulnerability) against dozens of US-based organizations. jtig at 2024-07-11T13:36:41.536Z ##

Very hot take: Outlook (classic) should be regarded as a high-risk application at this point, after the numerous critical vulnerabilities that keep being patched.

These CVE's are responsible for zero-click RCE or token theft in Outlook:

  • july 2024: CVE-2024-38021
  • june 2024: CVE-2024-30103 (requires user auth)
  • february 2024: CVE-2024-21413
  • august 2023: CVE-2023-35384
  • may 2023: CVE-2023-29324
  • march 2023: CVE-2023-23397

Outlook Web works just fine for me 🤷

##

EPSS: 97.16%

updated 2024-03-21T05:01:12

6 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.4 authentication bypass allowing to perform admin actions was possible

sleepycat at 2024-07-21T17:42:29.752Z ##

"Cloudflare observed exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-27198 (JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass) at 19:45 UTC on March 4, just 22 minutes after proof-of-concept code was published."

"The speed of exploitation of disclosed CVEs is often quicker than the speed at which humans can create WAF rules or create and deploy patches to mitigate attacks."

#cloudflare #ApplicationSecurity report

https://blog.cloudflare.com/application-security-report-2024-update

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T23:59:49.135Z ##

@vitriolix @campuscodi

Starting with JetBrains' security advisory on 04 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/ JetBrains was forced to publicly warn their customers that Rapid7 was going to imminently release Proofs of Concepts for the critical authentication bypass vulnerability.

The Rapid7's blog, released within an hour of JetBrains' advisory, does just that. The timeline tells you everything you need to know about how it went down: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

JetBrains, upset about the bad optics, releases "their side of the story" the next day: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/ In this blog, they readily admit to breaking protocol and refusing to do a coordinated vulnerability disclosure:

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

JetBrains, with their TeamCity customers under mass exploitation, doubles down and all but blames Rapid7 for releasing the PoCs in another blog post on 11 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/ They continue to insist on silent patching.

Since then, JetBrains has never published a security advisory in a blog post. You have to manually visit their Fixed security issues page to find CVE IDs. No other vendor takes over a week to identify the vulnerabilities and CVE IDs. If JetBrains didn't want the bad reputation, perhaps they should have written better code in the first place. Bug hunters who responsibly report these vulnerabilities are not the enemy here.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T15:40:17.783Z ##

JetBrains: TeamCity 2024.07 Is Here
I hate JetBrains but enough of you use TeamCity to report on this. TeamCity has a new version 2024.07 which came out today. Buried deep in their release notes is the only indication that any vulnerabilities were patched.

19 security problems have been fixed.

At this time of this toot, JetBrains' own Fixed security issues page is missing the 2024.07 dropdown option so they don't even identify any CVE IDs. A search for TeamCity on cve.mitre.org doesn't show any new CVEs since 01 July 2024.

Ever since JetBrains' feud with Rapid7 in March 2024, they are convinced that silent patching is the appropriate way to handle vulnerabilities. Now your customers don't even know why they should upgrade their TeamCity, or what n-day vulnerability they're being exploited with.

Patch your TeamCity. TeamCity vulnerabilities are known to be exploited by ransomware groups. cc: @campuscodi

#jetbrains #teamcity #vulnerability #cve

##
sleepycat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-21T17:42:29.000Z ##

"Cloudflare observed exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-27198 (JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass) at 19:45 UTC on March 4, just 22 minutes after proof-of-concept code was published."

"The speed of exploitation of disclosed CVEs is often quicker than the speed at which humans can create WAF rules or create and deploy patches to mitigate attacks."

#cloudflare #ApplicationSecurity report

https://blog.cloudflare.com/application-security-report-2024-update

##

CVE-2019-12814
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.54%

updated 2024-03-15T01:01:08

2 posts

A Polymorphic Typing issue was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind 2.x through 2.9.9. When Default Typing is enabled (either globally or for a specific property) for an externally exposed JSON endpoint and the service has JDOM 1.x or 2.x jar in the classpath, an attacker can send a specifically crafted JSON message that allows them to read arbitrary local files on the server.

1 repos

https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2019-12814

AAKL at 2024-07-23T15:38:06.180Z ##

Cyble: #Philips Discloses Multiple VUE PACS Vulnerabilities: Healthcare Sector Walking on Thin Ice https://cyble.com/blog/philips-discloses-multiple-vue-pacs-vulnerabilities-healthcare-sector-walking-on-thin-ice/ #cybersecurity #infosec

CVE-2021-28165; CVE-2023-40704; CVE-2023-40539; CVE-2023-40159

##

CVE-2024-27199
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.90%

updated 2024-03-11T15:31:24

4 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.4 path traversal allowing to perform limited admin actions was possible

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T23:59:49.135Z ##

@vitriolix @campuscodi

Starting with JetBrains' security advisory on 04 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/ JetBrains was forced to publicly warn their customers that Rapid7 was going to imminently release Proofs of Concepts for the critical authentication bypass vulnerability.

The Rapid7's blog, released within an hour of JetBrains' advisory, does just that. The timeline tells you everything you need to know about how it went down: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

JetBrains, upset about the bad optics, releases "their side of the story" the next day: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/ In this blog, they readily admit to breaking protocol and refusing to do a coordinated vulnerability disclosure:

At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7 as we strongly believe ...

JetBrains, with their TeamCity customers under mass exploitation, doubles down and all but blames Rapid7 for releasing the PoCs in another blog post on 11 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/preventing-exploits-jetbrains-ethical-approach-to-vulnerability-disclosure/ They continue to insist on silent patching.

Since then, JetBrains has never published a security advisory in a blog post. You have to manually visit their Fixed security issues page to find CVE IDs. No other vendor takes over a week to identify the vulnerabilities and CVE IDs. If JetBrains didn't want the bad reputation, perhaps they should have written better code in the first place. Bug hunters who responsibly report these vulnerabilities are not the enemy here.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-18T15:40:17.783Z ##

JetBrains: TeamCity 2024.07 Is Here
I hate JetBrains but enough of you use TeamCity to report on this. TeamCity has a new version 2024.07 which came out today. Buried deep in their release notes is the only indication that any vulnerabilities were patched.

19 security problems have been fixed.

At this time of this toot, JetBrains' own Fixed security issues page is missing the 2024.07 dropdown option so they don't even identify any CVE IDs. A search for TeamCity on cve.mitre.org doesn't show any new CVEs since 01 July 2024.

Ever since JetBrains' feud with Rapid7 in March 2024, they are convinced that silent patching is the appropriate way to handle vulnerabilities. Now your customers don't even know why they should upgrade their TeamCity, or what n-day vulnerability they're being exploited with.

Patch your TeamCity. TeamCity vulnerabilities are known to be exploited by ransomware groups. cc: @campuscodi

#jetbrains #teamcity #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-18T23:59:49.000Z ##

@vitriolix @campuscodi

Starting with JetBrains' security advisory on 04 March 2024: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/ JetBrains was forced to publicly warn their customers that Rapid7 was going to imminently release Proofs of Concepts for the critical authentication bypass vulnerability.

CVE-2023-44467
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-02-26T19:54:46

2 posts

langchain_experimental 0.0.14 allows an attacker to bypass the CVE-2023-36258 fix and execute arbitrary code via the PALChain in the python exec method.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.337Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.000Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2008-0166
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 8.17%

updated 2024-02-18T05:07:33

4 posts

OpenSSL 0.9.8c-1 up to versions before 0.9.8g-9 on Debian-based operating systems uses a random number generator that generates predictable numbers, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct brute force guessing attacks against cryptographic keys.

4 repos

https://github.com/demining/Vulnerable-to-Debian-OpenSSL-bug-CVE-2008-0166

https://github.com/avarx/vulnkeys

https://github.com/g0tmi1k/debian-ssh

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl

kurtseifried at 2024-07-19T23:22:21.171Z ##

@postmodern Yup, posting here again:

Here's the thing:

The worst, most impactful Open Source security issue was...

log4j? Hardly any outages, the only big one I know of was Canada Revenue Agency (Canadian IRS basically) shutdown their website for a week right before tax deadline, and granted an extensions. But this is their well known emergency plan for dealking with critical software vulns that could result in their system getting hacked (e.g. previous incidents like HEARTBLEED: https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/heartbleed-bug-cyberattack-canada-government-departments-1.3355993)

SPECTRE and MELTDOWN perhaps? Some buggy updates were released that could brick systems (https://www.securityweek.com/hp-dell-halt-bios-updates-over-buggy-cpu-patches/) but obviously nothing on the scale of this CrowdStrike issue.

Debian's OpenSSL "oopsie" back in 2008 https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2008-0166 but I'll be darned if I ever found real reports of exploitation having an actual impact.

I feel like if we took EVERY major open source incident, balled them together, we still wouldn't have 1% of the disruption that Crowdstrike caused.

I would challenge anyone to find open source security bugs that had a major impact and reply here, hint: they're hard to find because most of them had very, very minimal public facing impacts.

##

screaminggoat at 2024-07-17T14:47:25.315Z ##

Sygnia: The Return of Ghost Emperor's Demodex
A Chinese threat actor has been linked to a late 2023 attack that pivoted to the network of the victim's business partner. A variant of the Demodex rootkit was identified, associated with GhostEmperor. They are known to mainly target Southeast Asian telecommunications and government entities. While Sygnia mentions #ProxyLogon (CVE-2021-26855) as a previous initial access method, it does not elaborate and describes GhostEmperor's infection chain as using a batch file. Sygnia provides a technical analysis of the infection chain, and lists IOC.

h/t @therecord_media for the related reporting: ‘GhostEmperor’ returns: Mysterious Chinese hacking group spotted for first time in two years

#threatintel #ghostemperor #china #cyberespionage #IOC #CVE_2021_26855

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-17T14:47:25.000Z ##

Sygnia: The Return of Ghost Emperor's Demodex
A Chinese threat actor has been linked to a late 2023 attack that pivoted to the network of the victim's business partner. A variant of the Demodex rootkit was identified, associated with GhostEmperor. They are known to mainly target Southeast Asian telecommunications and government entities. While Sygnia mentions #ProxyLogon (CVE-2021-26855) as a previous initial access method, it does not elaborate and describes GhostEmperor's infection chain as using a batch file. Sygnia provides a technical analysis of the infection chain, and lists IOC.

h/t @therecord_media for the related reporting: ‘GhostEmperor’ returns: Mysterious Chinese hacking group spotted for first time in two years

#threatintel #ghostemperor #china #cyberespionage #IOC #CVE_2021_26855

##

CVE-2023-35636
(6.5 MEDIUM)

CVE-2023-46229
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2023-11-12T05:01:47

2 posts

LangChain before 0.0.317 allows SSRF via `document_loaders/recursive_url_loader.py` because crawling can proceed from an external server to an internal server.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.337Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-23T12:47:11.000Z ##

Unit 42: Vulnerabilities in LangChain Gen AI
LangChain Gen AI is supposedly a popular open source generative AI framework on GitHub. Palo Alto Networks researchers discovered two vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2023-46229 (8.8 high) LangChain server-side request forgery (SSRF)
  • CVE-2023-44467 (9.8 critical) LangChain prompt injection vulnerability.

Oddly, the MITRE/NVD description for CVE-2023-44467 states that it is a CVE-2023-36258 patch bypass but this article doesn't mention that CVE ID at all. Unit 42 provides technical analyses of both CVEs and proofs of concept.

#CVE_2023_36258 #CVE_2023_46229 #CVE_2023_44467 #LangChain #genAI #AI #vulnerability #CVE
